page.title: 15Housing in rural Buriton
page.content: All housing in Ditcham was built to service the Ditcham estate. They have their own water supply from 280 ft bore and 3 underground tanks. Also private sewage disposal. Downley was the school for estate workers' and blacksmiths' children. It is now for sale at Â£80,000. Sunwood Farm, originally a shepherd's cottage now has 540 acres. Swiss Cottage was built for lime works employees. Until recently 4 railway workers cottages bordered the railway line. Toads Alley was originally 3 cottages housing 17 people. Whistlers are 2 thatched cottages enlarged in 1983. Coulters Dean is occupied by an aged farmer/ owner who lets farm land. Reliant upon postman for shopping. Reliable water supply from well. There are forestry houses one to be sold to manager. Bungalow replaced by larger one.
